| **[MediaWiki REST API](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/API:REST_API "Special:MyLanguage/API:REST API")** |

|

 |
| [v](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Template:REST_API "Template:REST API") **·** [d](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Template_talk:REST_API) **·** [e](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=Template:REST_API&action=edit) |
The MediaWiki **REST API** lets you interact with MediaWiki by sending [HTTP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Transfer_Protocol "w:Hypertext Transfer Protocol") requests to `rest.php` URLs. You can use the API to build apps and scripts that search and display wiki pages, get media files, and explore page history.
## Quick start
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=1 "Edit section: Quick start")\]
\# Search English Wikipedia for an article about Earth $ curl "[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/rest.php/v1/search/page?q=earth&limit=1](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/rest.php/v1/search/page?q=earth&limit=1)"
[Try it out](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/rest.php/v1/search/page?q=earth&limit=1)
## Data format
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=2 "Edit section: Data format")\]
REST API endpoints return data in [JSON](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON "w:JSON") or [HTML](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML "w:HTML") format. See the [API reference](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/API:REST_API/Reference "Special:MyLanguage/API:REST API/Reference") for the content type supported by each endpoint.
## Methods
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=3 "Edit section: Methods")\]
The API supports standard [HTTP request methods](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Transfer_Protocol#Request_methods "w:Hypertext Transfer Protocol").
| GET | Retrieve resource |
| HEAD | Return [HTTP headers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_header_fields "w:List of HTTP header fields") for a GET request without response data |
| POST | Create resource |
| PUT | Update or create resource |
## URL structure
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=4 "Edit section: URL structure")\]
API endpoints share a consistent URL structure that includes the wiki's base URL, the wiki's [script path](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Manual:$wgScriptPath "Special:MyLanguage/Manual:$wgScriptPath"), and the API version.
\# URL structure
\[project url\]/\[script path\]/rest.php/v\[version number\]/
\# Example URL: Get the history of the Main Page of English Wikipedia
https://en.wikipedia.org/w/rest.php/v1/page/Main\_Page/history
## Versioning
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=5 "Edit section: Versioning")\]
Designed to provide long-term stability for developers, the MediaWiki REST API is versioned using a global version number in the API path (for example: `/v1/`). Following the principles of [semantic versioning](https://semver.org/), the version is incremented when an endpoint is changed in a backwards-incompatible way, such as removing a response property or adding a required parameter. Within a major version, the API may change in backwards-compatible ways, such as adding a response property or optional request parameter.
| `/v1/` (latest) | Available since [MediaWiki 1.35](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/MediaWiki_1.35 "Special:MyLanguage/MediaWiki 1.35")[](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/MediaWiki_1.35 "MediaWiki 1.35") |
## Permissions and authorization
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=6 "Edit section: Permissions and authorization")\]
The REST API is designed to be used with the [OAuth](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Extension:OAuth "Special:MyLanguage/Extension:OAuth") [](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:OAuth "Extension:OAuth")extension for user authentication and authorization. However, regardless of the authentication method, the API responds to the presence of a logged-in user and returns content appropriate to that user's permissions.
## Accessing Wikimedia projects using the REST API
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=7 "Edit section: Accessing Wikimedia projects using the REST API")\]
You can use the REST API to access [Wikipedia](https://www.wikipedia.org/), [Wiktionary](https://www.wiktionary.org/), and other Wikimedia projects in multiple languages. For a complete list of Wikimedia project URLs, see [Meta-Wiki’s site matrix](https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:SiteMatrix "m:Special:SiteMatrix").
### Request limit
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=8 "Edit section: Request limit")\]
There is no fixed limit on requests to the API, but your client may be blocked if you endanger the stability of a site. To stay within a safe request rate, wait for each request to finish before sending another request.
### Client identification
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=9 "Edit section: Client identification")\]
Wikimedia sites require an HTTP [User-Agent header](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User-Agent_header "w:User-Agent header") for all API requests. This helps identify your app and ensures that system administrators can contact you if a problem arises. Clients making requests without a User-Agent header may be IP-blocked without notice.
The User-Agent header can include a user page on the local wiki, a user page on a related wiki using [interwiki linking syntax](https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:Interwiki_linking_on_Wikimedia_wikis "m:Special:MyLanguage/Help:Interwiki linking on Wikimedia wikis"), a URL for a relevant external website, or an email address.
\# Preferred format for User-Agent headers
<client name>/<version> (<contact information>) <library/framework name>/<version>
If you are calling the API from browser-based JavaScript, you may not be able to influence the User-Agent header, depending on the browser. To work around this, use the `Api-User-Agent` header. See the [User-Agent policy](https://foundation.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Policy:User-Agent_policy "foundation:Special:MyLanguage/Policy:User-Agent policy") for more information.
### Authorization
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=10 "Edit section: Authorization")\]
To authorize your app to act on behalf of a user, follow the [OAuth developer guide](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/OAuth/For_Developers "Special:MyLanguage/OAuth/For Developers") to register your app and make requests using OAuth tokens.
### Licensing and trademarks
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=11 "Edit section: Licensing and trademarks")\]
Wikimedia content is free to reuse within the terms specified by the applicable license. Licenses can differ between projects, so see the individual project for information about licenses and content reuse. For example, English Wikipedia’s text can be used under the terms of the [Creative Commons Attribution Share-Alike license](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Text_of_Creative_Commons_Attribution-ShareAlike_4.0_International_License "w:Wikipedia:Text of Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License"), while media files on [Wikimedia Commons](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Commons:Reusing_content_outside_Wikimedia "c:Special:MyLanguage/Commons:Reusing content outside Wikimedia") are licensed individually as indicated on the file’s information page. For more information about licensing and trademark use, see [Meta-Wiki’s developer app guidelines](https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Developer_app_guidelines "m:Special:MyLanguage/Developer app guidelines").
### Limitations on Wikidata
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=12 "Edit section: Limitations on Wikidata")\]
While the REST API is available on Wikimedia projects, it is not fully supported by Wikidata. As of writing, some of the endpoints may return unexpected errors. Instead, use the [Wikidata REST API](https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Wikidata:REST_API "wikidata:Special:MyLanguage/Wikidata:REST API").
## Extension endpoints
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=13 "Edit section: Extension endpoints")\]
MediaWiki extensions can provide extension-specific API endpoints using the REST API interface. See the [REST API extension interface docs](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/API:REST/Extensions "Special:MyLanguage/API:REST/Extensions") to get started. In [MediaWiki 1.35](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/MediaWiki_1.35 "Special:MyLanguage/MediaWiki 1.35") [](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/MediaWiki_1.35 "MediaWiki 1.35")and later, the REST API extension interface is available by default.

## About these docs
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=15 "Edit section: About these docs")\]
These docs are written manually based on the [MediaWiki Core source code](https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/g/mediawiki/core/%2B/HEAD/includes/Rest "git:mediawiki/core/+/HEAD/includes/Rest"). Corrections and additions are welcome! To share a tutorial or app that uses the MediaWiki REST API, add a link to the [REST API template](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Template:REST_API "Special:MyLanguage/Template:REST API").
## Code stewardship
\[[edit](https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=API:REST_API&action=edit&section=16 "Edit section: Code stewardship")\]
